Back to Joseph Haydn

Joseph Haydn

Gott Erhalte, Hob. XXVIa:43

1797

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

This is the piano version of Haydn’s song Gott Erhalte, which can be played without the sung text.

Haydn later wrote a set of variations on this theme, which constitute the second movement of the string quartet in C major (Hob. III:77), and further made an arrangement of these variations for solo piano.

Recommended editions

  • Könemann · K 219 · Klavierstücke II · ed. Miklós Dolinszky
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50047 · Klavierstücke · ed. Franz Eibner / Gerschon Jarecki

Duration: 1'

Difficulty: 1.5
